host.description: Host Endpoint of the Redshift Cluster (must include the cluster-id, region and end with .redshift.amazonaws.com)
host.title: Host

username.description: Username to use to access the database.
username.title: Username

schema.description: The default schema tables are written to if the source does not specify a namespace. Unless specifically configured, the usual value for this field is "public".
schema.title: Default Schema

jdbc_url_params.description: Additional properties to pass to the JDBC URL string when connecting to the database formatted as 'key=value' pairs separated by the symbol '&'. (example: key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3).
jdbc_url_params.title: JDBC URL Params

oneOf.title: AWS S3 Staging
oneOf.description: Uploads data to S3 and then uses a COPY to insert the data into Redshift. COPY is recommended for production workloads for better speed and scalability.

s3_bucket_name.description: The name of the staging S3 bucket.
s3_bucket_name.title: S3 Bucket Name

s3_bucket_path.description: The directory under the S3 bucket where data will be written. If not provided, then defaults to the root directory.
s3_bucket_path.title: S3 Bucket Path

s3_bucket_region.description: The region of the S3 staging bucket.
s3_bucket_region.title: S3 Bucket Region

access_key_id.description: This ID grants access to the above S3 staging bucket. Airbyte requires Read and Write permissions to the given bucket.
access_key_id.title: S3 Access Key Id

secret_access_key.description: The corresponding secret to the above access key id.
secret_access_key.title: S3 Secret Access Key

file_name_pattern.description: The pattern allows you to set the file-name format for the S3 staging file(s)
file_name_pattern.title: S3 Filename pattern

purge_staging_data.description: Whether to delete the staging files from S3 after completing the sync.
purge_staging_data.title: Purge Staging Files and Tables

uploading_method.description: The way data will be uploaded to Redshift.
uploading_method.title: Uploading Method

drop_cascade.description: Drop tables with CASCADE. WARNING! This will delete all data in all dependent objects (views, etc.). Use with caution. This option is intended for usecases which can easily rebuild the dependent objects.
drop_cascade.title: Drop tables with CASCADE. (WARNING! Risk of unrecoverable data loss)

raw_data_schema.description: The schema to use for internal Airbyte tables (default: airbyte_internal).
raw_data_schema.title: Internal Tables Schema

oneOf.title: No Tunnel
oneOf.description: No ssh tunnel needed to connect to database

oneOf.title: SSH Key Authentication
oneOf.description: Connect through a jump server tunnel host using username and ssh key

tunnel_host.description: Hostname of the jump server host that allows inbound ssh tunnel.
tunnel_host.title: SSH Tunnel Jump Server Host

tunnel_port.description: Port on the proxy/jump server that accepts inbound ssh connections.
tunnel_port.title: SSH Connection Port

tunnel_user.description: OS-level username for logging into the jump server host
tunnel_user.title: SSH Login Username

ssh_key.description: OS-level user account ssh key credentials in RSA PEM format ( created with ssh-keygen -t rsa -m PEM -f myuser_rsa )
ssh_key.title: SSH Private Key

oneOf.title: Password Authentication
oneOf.description: Connect through a jump server tunnel host using username and password authentication

tunnel_host.description: Hostname of the jump server host that allows inbound ssh tunnel.
tunnel_host.title: SSH Tunnel Jump Server Host

tunnel_port.description: Port on the proxy/jump server that accepts inbound ssh connections.
tunnel_port.title: SSH Connection Port

tunnel_user.description: OS-level username for logging into the jump server host
tunnel_user.title: SSH Login Username

tunnel_user_password.description: OS-level password for logging into the jump server host
tunnel_user_password.title: Password

tunnel_method.description: Whether to initiate an SSH tunnel before connecting to the database, and if so, which kind of authentication to use.
tunnel_method.title: SSH Tunnel Method
